answer_options.C: Next, we will explore how the printing press made books even more common centuries later.
answer_options.D: Therefore, the invention of paper made reading and writing accessible to many more people throughout society.

answer_explanation: Option D is correct because it synthesizes the paragraph’s central idea that paper—being lightweight and inexpensive—allowed knowledge to spread widely, providing a clear closing statement that restates the main point without introducing new information.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the paragraph below. Which choice would be the BEST concluding statement for this paragraph?

"Libraries are important community spaces that provide free access to books and information. Visitors can check out fiction and nonfiction books on many subjects. Librarians are trained to help people find exactly what they are looking for. Many libraries also offer free programs like book clubs and reading hours for families."

answer_options.A: The first public library in America opened in 1833 in New Hampshire.
answer_options.B: In short, libraries serve as helpful centers that connect people with books and learning opportunities.
answer_options.C: Librarians wear name tags and sit at the front desk.
answer_options.D: Books are printed on paper made from trees.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it summarizes the main idea that libraries provide access to books and community services, effectively wrapping up the paragraph with a final thought about their purpose.
subject: ELA

question: Which sentence best begins a story by introducing the narrator and establishing the situation?

answer_options.A: The storm clouds gathered darkly over the small town.
answer_options.B: My name is Jun, and I am about to enter the spelling bee for the first time.
answer_options.C: They huddled together under the umbrella as the rain poured down.
answer_options.D: Finally, we reached the top of the mountain and could see for miles.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it introduces the narrator (Jun) and establishes the situation (entering the spelling bee for the first time), which fulfills the standard of introducing a narrator and setting up the context at the beginning of a story.
subject: ELA

question: Which choice shows a story opening that best establishes a situation, introduces the narrator or characters, and organizes events in a sequence that unfolds naturally?

answer_options.A: In the dusty attic sat a wooden chest that creaked when the wind blew.
answer_options.B: We celebrated our victory. Before the race started, my sister and I had tied our shoes tight.
answer_options.C: Yesterday after school, my best friend Tyler and I climbed into my treehouse, but we froze when heavy footsteps sounded on the ladder.
answer_options.D: Basketball games are loud and fast when players dribble down the court.

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because it establishes the situation with the time marker 'Yesterday after school' and the specific setting of the treehouse, introduces both the narrator and the character Tyler, and presents events in a natural chronological sequence: the characters first climb into the treehouse and then freeze in reaction to hearing unexpected footsteps climbing up behind them.
subject: ELA

question: Which opening best establishes a situation, introduces the narrator or characters, and begins a natural sequence of events?

answer_options.A: The old cabin stood at the edge of the dark woods, surrounded by tall oak trees.
answer_options.B: Many families enjoy spending their vacations in quiet, peaceful places.
answer_options.C: Yesterday morning, I woke up early and packed my backpack for the big hike with my scout troop.
answer_options.D: A trail map, water bottles, and sturdy boots are important for any hiking trip.

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because it establishes the situation (preparing for a hike yesterday morning), introduces the narrator ('I') and characters (the scout troop), and begins a natural sequence of events (waking up early and packing the backpack suggests the hike will happen next).
subject: ELA

question: Jake's team just lost the soccer game. Which choice shows what Jake says and does?

answer_options.A: "I can't believe it!" yelled Jake, kicking the dirt with his shoe.
answer_options.B: Jake was angry that he lost the game.
answer_options.C: Jake thought about winning next time.
answer_options.D: The game ended with a score of three to two.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it includes Jake's dialogue within quotation marks showing what he says, combined with a description of his action (kicking the dirt), which together demonstrate his response to losing the game.
subject: ELA

question:
Read this part of a story:

The school bell had already rung, but Nico's locker was stuck. He pulled and pulled, but the metal door wouldn't budge.

Which option BEST uses dialogue and descriptions of actions, thoughts, and feelings to develop the event and show Nico's response?

answer_options.A: "Not now!" Nico muttered, yanking the handle again. His palms grew sweaty as he imagined being late for class again.
answer_options.B: Nico was worried about being late to class, so he kept trying to open the locker.
answer_options.C: "This locker always jams," Nico said, looking at the hallway.
answer_options.D: Nico pulled harder and felt scared.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it uses dialogue ("Not now!"), describes actions (yanking the handle), and reveals Nico's thoughts and feelings (sweaty palms, imagining being late). This combination develops the event and clearly shows his response to the stuck locker, satisfying the standard's requirement to use dialogue along with descriptions of actions, thoughts, and feelings.
subject: ELA

question: Liam just won the spelling bee. Which choice BEST shows Liam's response using both dialogue and a description of action or feeling?

answer_options.A: "I won!" shouted Liam.
answer_options.B: Liam felt really happy about winning.
answer_options.C: "I can't believe it!" cheered Liam, waving his trophy in the air.
answer_options.D: Liam waved his trophy in the air.

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because it includes dialogue ("I can't believe it!") and a description of action (waving his trophy in the air), which together show how Liam responds to winning the spelling bee.
subject: ELA

question:
Which choice best completes the sentence to show the order of events?

"_______, we lined up at the door. Then, we walked to the cafeteria."

answer_options.A: However
answer_options.B: First
answer_options.C: Because
answer_options.D: Although

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because 'First' is a temporal word that signals the beginning of a sequence of events, clearly showing that lining up at the door happened before walking to the cafeteria.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the paragraph. It has four blanks.

[1] ________, the orchestra tuned their instruments.
[2] ________, the conductor raised the baton.
[3] ________, the musicians began the overture.
[4] ________, the audience erupted in applause.

Which choice BEST completes blanks [1]–[4] to show clear time order?

answer_options.A: First, Meanwhile, Next, Finally
answer_options.B: Initially, Subsequently, Thereafter, Ultimately
answer_options.C: First, Next, After that, Earlier
answer_options.D: To begin with, Then, Before long, At last

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because 'Initially' signals the opening action, 'Subsequently' indicates the next event in sequence, 'Thereafter' marks the following step, and 'Ultimately' identifies the final outcome, establishing a clear, uninterrupted chronological order from start to finish.
subject: ELA

question:
Which choice uses temporal words to correctly show the order of events?

Maya wanted to bake cookies. ______, she preheated the oven. ______, she mixed the dough. ______, she put the cookies in the oven to bake.

answer_options.A: First, Next, Finally
answer_options.B: Because, And, But
answer_options.C: Next, First, Finally
answer_options.D: First, Finally, Next

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it uses the temporal words "First," "Next," and "Finally" to clearly signal the chronological order of the events: preheating the oven first, mixing the dough next, and baking the cookies finally.
subject: ELA

question:
Which choice best gives this story a sense of closure?

Tom was nervous about his first day at a new school. He walked through the front doors and introduced himself to his classmates. By lunchtime, he had already made two new friends.

answer_options.A: Tom ate his sandwich at the lunch table.
answer_options.B: Tom felt happy that his new school already felt like home.
answer_options.C: Tom asked his new friends where to find the gym.
answer_options.D: Tom wondered what he would learn in math class tomorrow.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it resolves Tom's nervousness from the beginning and shows how the problem was solved, giving the story a finished feeling.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the story below. Which choice best provides a sense of closure?

"Lila had practiced her piano piece for weeks before the recital. Her fingers trembled as she sat on the bench and looked at the keys. When she finished playing the final note, the audience erupted in applause. Lila stood and took a bow, her heart pounding with joy."

answer_options.A: She walked offstage and hugged her teacher, grateful her hard work had finally paid off.
answer_options.B: Suddenly, she noticed her sheet music slipping off the stand and lunged to catch it.
answer_options.C: The piano strings vibrated with rich, warm sound as she pressed each key.
answer_options.D: Lila couldn't wait to learn an even harder piece for next year's recital.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it shows Lila finishing her performance, acknowledging her achievement, and reflecting on her preparation, all of which signal that the experience is complete and the story has reached its conclusion.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the paragraph.

Maya had never ridden a horse before. At first, she felt nervous as the instructor helped her into the saddle. The horse walked slowly around the ring while Maya held on tight. By the end of the lesson, she was sitting up straight and even gave the horse a gentle pat.

Which sentence best ends the paragraph and provides a sense of closure?

answer_options.A: Maya asked her instructor when she could come back for another lesson.
answer_options.B: Maya grinned and whispered, 'That was amazing,' as she hugged the horse's neck.
answer_options.C: The riding ring was surrounded by a white fence and tall trees.
answer_options.D: She wondered if her friends would also like to try horseback riding.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it provides a sense of closure by showing Maya's positive emotional reaction and sense of accomplishment immediately after completing the ride, which wraps up the narrative experience with a feeling of finality and satisfaction.
subject: ELA

question: You are writing a thank-you note to your teacher after a class field trip to the zoo. Which choice shows the best beginning for your note?

answer_options.A: Dear Teacher, I didn't want to go to the zoo but it was okay I guess.
answer_options.B: To Whom It May Concern: I am writing to document the recent zoo excursion.
answer_options.C: Dear Mrs. Lee, Thank you for taking us to the zoo. I loved watching the penguins swim!
answer_options.D: Once upon a time, a class visited the zoo and saw many amazing animals.

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because it uses a friendly greeting appropriate for a teacher, clearly states the purpose of thanking her for the trip, and includes a specific detail about the experience, which matches the task of writing a thank-you note and the purpose of expressing gratitude.
subject: ELA

question: Which choice best demonstrates the skill described in W.3.4 at hard difficulty?

answer_options.A: The correct choice that matches the standard.
answer_options.B: An incorrect distractor.
answer_options.C: Another incorrect distractor.
answer_options.D: Another incorrect distractor.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it matches the skill described in the standard.
subject: ELA

question: A student is asked to write a paragraph to convince the principal that the school should start a recycling program. Which choice shows writing that is developed and organized appropriately for this task and purpose?

answer_options.A: Recycling is good for the Earth. We should recycle at school. My family recycles at home. Recycling helps animals. We need bins in every classroom. It is important.
answer_options.B: Our school should start a recycling program. Recycling reduces trash and teaches students to care for the Earth. This would make our school a better place.
answer_options.C: Last summer, I visited the beach with my family. I saw plastic bottles in the sand and picked them up. Putting them in the recycling bin made me feel happy.
answer_options.D: Recycling is important and everyone should do it every single day at school, at home, and everywhere in the whole world.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it presents a clear opinion, provides specific reasons that support the argument, and follows a logical organizational structure appropriate for convincing the principal. The other choices are either disorganized lists, off-topic narratives, or underdeveloped statements that lack sufficient support.
subject: ELA

question: Tom added more details to his story after his teacher gave him ideas. He also fixed some spelling mistakes. Which choice best describes Tom's actions?

answer_options.A: Planning the story before writing it
answer_options.B: Revising and editing with teacher support
answer_options.C: Publishing the final copy for readers
answer_options.D: Brainstorming ideas for a new story

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because Tom strengthened his existing writing by adding details (revising) and correcting spelling errors (editing) using guidance from his teacher, which aligns with developing writing through revision and editing with adult support.
subject: ELA

question:
Maya wrote this draft about her soccer game:

"yesterday we played soccer it was fun i scored a goal then we won the game"

Her classmate said, “I want to know what you were feeling right before you scored.”
Her teacher said, “Your sentences run together. Add an introduction, separate your ideas, and fix the capitalization and punctuation.”

Which choice best shows Maya developing and strengthening her writing by planning, revising, and editing with this guidance?

answer_options.A: Make a quick outline with an introduction, the scoring moment, and a conclusion; rewrite to add her nervous thoughts before the goal and split the run-on sentence into shorter ones; then correct the capitalization and punctuation.
answer_options.B: Add intensifier words like “very” and “really” to each sentence to sound more exciting, but keep the run-on structure and skip adding any feelings.
answer_options.C: Only fix the capitalization at the beginning and add periods at the end, without adding the requested details or breaking apart the run-on sentence.
answer_options.D: Start a brand-new story about a piano recital instead of using the feedback to improve the current soccer paragraph.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it demonstrates the complete writing process: Maya plans by creating an outline with specific sections, revises by adding the emotional details requested by her peer and fixing the run-on sentence structure noted by her teacher, and edits by correcting capitalization and punctuation. This approach addresses both the peer’s request for feelings and the teacher’s guidance on organization and conventions.
subject: ELA

question: During writing workshop, a student shows this draft to a partner: "My birthday party was fun. We ate cake. We played games." The partner gives advice to help strengthen the writing. Which choice best shows what the partner should suggest?

answer_options.A: Check that all words are spelled correctly and add missing punctuation.
answer_options.B: Combine the short sentences and add describing words about the cake and games.
answer_options.C: Make a list of gift ideas before starting to write the draft.
answer_options.D: Recopy the paragraph in neat handwriting on a clean sheet of paper.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it demonstrates revising by combining short sentences to improve flow and adding descriptive details to strengthen the content of the writing. This aligns with the standard's focus on developing and strengthening writing through revision.
subject: ELA

question: With help from a teacher, which action shows using a computer to write a story and share it with classmates?

answer_options.A: Writing a story with a pencil and reading it aloud to the class
answer_options.B: Typing a story on a computer, posting it on the class website, and commenting on classmates' stories
answer_options.C: Drawing a picture about a story and hanging it in the hallway
answer_options.D: Reading a story on a tablet without writing anything

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because typing uses keyboarding skills to produce the writing, posting it on the class website publishes the work, and commenting on classmates' stories demonstrates interaction and collaboration with others.
subject: ELA

question: Which scenario best shows a third-grader fully meeting the standard of using technology, with adult guidance, to produce and publish writing while also interacting with others?

answer_options.A: With the librarian's guidance, Liam types a research report on the computer, emails it to his project partner for revisions, and uploads the final draft to the class wiki.
answer_options.B: Maya handwrites a story during journal time, and her father later types it and posts it on a family blog.
answer_options.C: Noah uses a tablet to type a book review by himself at home, saves it only to his device, and does not share it with anyone.
answer_options.D: Emma prints copies of her handwritten essay and distributes them to classmates during morning meeting.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it demonstrates the student receiving guidance from an adult (the librarian), using keyboarding skills to produce writing (typing on the computer), interacting and collaborating with others (emailing a partner for revisions), and publishing the writing (uploading to the class wiki), thereby satisfying all components of the standard.
subject: ELA

question: Which choice best shows a third grader using technology to write, publish, and work with others while getting help from a teacher?

answer_options.A: Writing a story by hand in a notebook and reading it aloud to classmates.
answer_options.B: Typing a story on a laptop, saving it to the desktop, and showing it only to the teacher.
answer_options.C: Typing a report on a computer, uploading it to the class website, and discussing it with online pen pals while the teacher supervises.
answer_options.D: Recording a video of himself telling a story and posting it on a video sharing site.

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because it demonstrates using keyboarding skills to produce the writing on a computer, publishing the work by uploading it to the class website, interacting and collaborating with others through discussion with online pen pals, and receiving guidance and support from the teacher who supervises.
subject: ELA

question: Which activity shows a short research project about butterflies?

answer_options.A: Writing a made-up story about a talking butterfly
answer_options.B: Reading a library book about butterflies and writing down two new facts
answer_options.C: Drawing a picture of a butterfly without learning any new information
answer_options.D: Guessing what butterflies eat without looking at any books

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because conducting a short research project means gathering information from sources such as books to learn about a topic and recording facts to build knowledge.
subject: ELA

question: Four students are planning short research projects about how cheetahs run fast. Which choice best shows a student conducting a short research project that builds knowledge?

answer_options.A: The student copies one paragraph from each of three websites and pastes them together for the report.
answer_options.B: The student reads two books and watches one video about cheetah speed, takes notes, and writes sentences combining what she learned from all three sources.
answer_options.C: The student looks at 20 books about every wild cat but cannot decide which facts to use.
answer_options.D: The student asks a friend what he knows about cheetahs and writes down those ideas.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it demonstrates a short research project that builds knowledge: the student consults multiple credible sources (two books and one video), takes organized notes to process the information, and synthesizes ideas by combining what she learned from different sources into her own sentences. This shows active knowledge construction rather than merely copying or collecting facts.
subject: ELA

question: Nora wants to conduct a short research project about honeybees to learn more about how they make honey. Which choice shows the best way for her to build knowledge about this topic?

answer_options.A: Draw a picture of a beehive without reading any books.
answer_options.B: Ask her mom what she thinks about bees and write down only that answer.
answer_options.C: Read a book about honeybees, watch an educational video, and take notes about how bees collect nectar.
answer_options.D: Copy one paragraph from the internet without checking if the facts are true.

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because it shows Nora using multiple reliable sources (a book and a video) and recording specific information in her own notes, which is how a short research project builds knowledge about a topic.
subject: ELA

question: Mia is writing a report about butterflies. She gathers information from a library book and an online article. Which choice shows she is following the steps for good research?

answer_options.A: She copies whole paragraphs from the book into her notebook.
answer_options.B: She writes short notes from both sources and sorts them into categories like "Life Cycle" and "Food."
answer_options.C: She only writes down what she already remembers about butterflies.
answer_options.D: She reads the sources but does not organize her notes into any groups.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it shows Mia gathering information from print and digital sources, taking brief notes (short facts), and sorting the evidence into provided categories ("Life Cycle" and "Food"), which aligns with the research process described in the standard.
subject: ELA

question:
A student is researching how animals survive winter. The teacher provided two categories: 'Physical Adaptations' and 'Behavioral Adaptations.' The student gathered information from three sources: a library book, a website, and personal observation.

Source 1 (Book: *Wild Winter*): 'Arctic foxes grow thick white fur that blends with snow.'
Source 2 (Website: *Nature Kids*): 'Some birds fly south to warmer areas when cold weather arrives.'
Source 3 (Personal observation): 'I watched squirrels burying acorns under the leaves in my yard.'

Which choice shows notes that correctly follow W.3.8 by taking brief notes on all sources and sorting the evidence into the provided categories?

answer_options.A: The student copied: 'Arctic foxes grow thick white fur that blends with snow. Some birds fly south to warmer areas when cold weather arrives. I watched squirrels burying acorns under the leaves in my yard.' The student placed all notes under 'Physical Adaptations'.
answer_options.B: The student wrote: 'Book: Thick white fur blends with snow; Website: Birds fly south for warmth; My observation: Squirrels bury acorns in yard.' The student placed 'fur' under 'Physical Adaptations' and both 'fly south' and 'bury acorns' under 'Behavioral Adaptations'.
answer_options.C: The student wrote: 'Book: Thick white fur blends with snow; Website: Birds fly south for warmth; My observation: Squirrels bury acorns in yard.' The student placed 'fur' and 'bury acorns' under 'Physical Adaptations' and 'fly south' under 'Behavioral Adaptations'.
answer_options.D: The student wrote: 'Source A: Thick white fur; Source B: Birds migrate; Source C: Squirrels store food.' The student placed all notes under 'Animal Changes'.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it demonstrates brief note-taking that identifies each specific source (Book, Website, My observation) and correctly sorts the evidence into the teacher's provided categories: thick white fur is a physical adaptation, while flying south (migration) and burying acorns (food storage behavior) are behavioral adaptations.
subject: ELA

question:
Mia is writing a report about healthy snacks. She gathered information from a book and a website and also recalled her own experience. She wrote these brief notes and labeled each source:

• Note 1: "Apple slices have fiber. (Healthy Eating, p. 12)"
• Note 2: "Carrot sticks help eyesight. (KidsNutrition.gov)"
• Note 3: "I eat bananas after school. (my own experience)"

Her teacher provided two categories for sorting the evidence: "Fruit Snacks" and "Vegetable Snacks."

Which choice shows how Mia should sort her notes into the provided categories?

answer_options.A: Put Note 1 and Note 3 in "Fruit Snacks" and Note 2 in "Vegetable Snacks."
answer_options.B: Put Note 1 in "Vegetable Snacks" and Note 2 and Note 3 in "Fruit Snacks."
answer_options.C: Put all three notes in "Fruit Snacks."
answer_options.D: Put all three notes in "Vegetable Snacks."

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because apples and bananas are fruits, so Notes 1 and 3 belong in the "Fruit Snacks" category, while carrots are vegetables, so Note 2 belongs in the "Vegetable Snacks" category. This demonstrates sorting brief notes from print sources, a digital source, and personal experience into the provided categories.
subject: ELA
